issue.title: [CF 1003] Rune of Power Buff
issue.body:
I'm trying to create an icon that tells me when I'm standing in my RoP.  The icon should appear once I'm in my RoP and turn off when I am not.  I've been struggling to get this buff detection to work.  I've been using the buff\debuff section and trying to detect RoP buff on myself.  I've noted there is a section for RoP, this looks like it will tell me that the RoP recticle is on the ground.  I just want to make sure I'm standing in it during a hectic battle  -any help would be appreciated.


> Posted by CurseForge user Iannet | Imported from CurseForge issue #1003 | Raw

comments.body:
Import this and try it (I added conditionals like you're alive, not mounted, in combat, not in a vehicle, not in a pet battle, and using the RoP talent):

^1^T^SType^Scooldown ^SName^SRune`of`Power ^SConditions^T ^N1^T ^SType^STALENTLEARNED ^SName^SRune`of`Power ^t^N2^T ^SType^SBUFFDUR ^SChecked^B ^SName^SRune`of`Power ^t^N3^T ^SType^SMOUNTED ^SLevel^N1 ^t^N4^T ^SType^SINPETBATTLE ^SLevel^N1 ^t^N5^T ^SType^SALIVE ^t^N6^T ^SType^SCOMBAT ^t^N7^T ^SType^SVEHICLE ^SLevel^N1 ^t^Sn^N7 ^t^SEnabled^B ^t^N71101^S`| ^Sicon^^


> Posted by CurseForge user John454ss

John, thank you for this. It doesn't appear to be doing what I want it to do. It appears to be setup as a spell cooldown. Just to reiterate, I want to know when I don't have the buff - at this point I want the icon to appear and stay on my screen until I have the buff again while in combat and alive (thank you for some of the conditions). Effectively, I lay down 2 RoP and with heavy movement, I may slide to the edge of the RoP area. If I slide too far, I will be out of the RoP area and want TMW to let me know. Thanks


> Posted by CurseForge user Iannet

This should work just fine with the simplest configuration of a Buff/Debuff icon - just create one and set it to track Rune of Power. No need to change any other settings.

^1^T^SType^Sbuff ^SName^SRune~`of~`Power ^SEnabled^B ^t^N71045^S~`~| ^Sicon^^


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Thank you John. I have setup many icons without issue. I seemed to have struggled with this one. I spent quite a bit of time on it. This works very well, thank you.


> Posted by CurseForge user Iannet
